data.title: Cozy
data.text:
First visit. They have a small inside bar area, an inside dinning area, an outside bar area and an outside picnic table area.

The wine selection is limited but plenty good enough if you are just out for a social outing. They have small plates and pizzas.

I expect that this place is really fun when the heat of summer subsides and you can enjoy the outdoor seating.

Old town small house with parking in the back.

data.title: Early bird
data.text: Visited in the late afternoon on a Saturday just after they opened for the evening. The service was friendly and prompt.  The wine selection was small, but well chosen.  We tried the white wine flight which were all Greek wines.  Great way to explore their wine menu.  Also had the cheese plate (portions were a bit small) and one of the pizzas - light and delicious with a crispy thin crust.

data.title: So much Fun!
data.text: Three of us went there on Saturday night had great wine and played a game! The chocolate was wonderful too. They serve flights of wine so you can taste several in either whites or reds. Love the people that worked there. So friendly and helpful. It is a cozy place to talk with your friends and had really good music. We will definitely go back!

data.title: Quaint and Friendly
data.text: I just love visiting this place.  The owners are very welcoming and love to talk about their vision.  They've done an excellent job decorating the old home in downtown Frisco.  Service is always friendly and it's just fun to enjoy a nice glass of wine with friends.  I love to sit in their garden in the summer.  Their house selection of wine doesn't seem to rotate much, but they do have a nice selection by the bottle.  They also do nice local craft beers.  I love that they always have live music as well.

data.title: lovely setting amid city with boring chain restaurants
data.text:
Enjoyed this Austin style old house with a shabby chic interior and easy going service.
So different than the complete snooze of other modern parts of Frisco. 
Had the cheese board with meat and the pimento cheese sliders.
Offers good prices on house wines for happy hour. 
Would like to see them add more Texas wines as we have so many good ones from the state.

data.title: Cute place - terrible selection of wine
data.text: I struggle giving this even three stars, but it's a cute place.  The wine list is so small for a WINE BAR.  Priced too high, very little selection, and the red wine was served WARM.  A wine bar should really have a great selection and serve wine at the correct temperature.  If you are looking for a place to hang out with friends, this would be great, but you may want to have a beer instead of wine.  Don't go if you're looking for something new.  The sav blanc they offer is smoking loon, which is next to barefoot and yellow tail... the price for the glass is more than the price of the bottle at the grocery store.

data.title: Charming atmosphere
data.text: We enjoyed our drinks here.  Although we came in 20 mins before closing and we didn't feel as welcomed as other people have mentioned.  Would like to visit again, as we didn't have food and the selection on offer looked homely and tasty!

data.title: Best Hidden Gem in Frisco
data.text:
Ok, let's establish this place is the best in Frisco. The whole experience starts with a warm welcome of 'make yourself at home,' and the experience gets better from there. 811 has a curated wine selection that feels very personal to the restaurant. I've only seen one bottle they carry that is sold retail. Some of the reviews said the wine markup is huge. I don't really mind, but I don't nickel and dime myself to drinking at home either. I'd also like to drink good some amongst friends than order a case from Amazon and watch a movie at home.

Ok, the waitstaff is an amazing refreshment of quirky-knowledgeable. I love that it's so much different than Chili's and Applebees. 

The beer selection is ever-changing. I like to drink IPAs year-round, and I'm rarely disappointed.

The best thing are the folks you meet at 811. Everyone is super chill, and chatting with like-minded folks is always welcomed. The ambiance is perfect for it.

data.title: Great little chill out spot
data.text: My wife and I have been coming to Eight 11 for close to a year or so now and it's the ambiance, great food and drinks and good times with friends that keep us coming back for more. Love sitting out back under the stars with a nice glass of wine or pint of local beer. We're so glad that the place is doing well and hope it sticks around for a good long while!

data.title: Wonderful atmosphere, wine and menu
data.text: Highly recommend 811 for couples and friends night out! Chill atmosphere and local artists' work make it a fun place to relax and have a few drinks. Great little menu at the bar and a nice back patio yard too!

data.title: Wonderful find!
data.text:
We met some friends at Eight 11 for a dinner one Saturday night. I had noticed the place, and wanted to try it out. I'm glad we did! The restuarant is very initimate and cozy with a lovely sitting area outside. They only offer local beer and no sodas, which was a nice change. My friend and I tried the red wine flight and ended up getting a bottle of one of the wines.

The food was delicious! The food is tapas style, in small style and to be shared. Everything we tried was wonderful, specially the smoked salmon and pesto bruschetta! They also bring s'mores to the table where you roast marshmallows over a candle - that was a lot of fun!

The staff was very friendly and had greast suggestions on what and how much to order.

I strongly recommend this place as a change to the more run of the mill offerings in the area. Great place for date night!

data.title: Wonderful Energy
data.text: What a great find.  A very rustic location off the main street of older Frisco.  The restaurant is a renovated house with the charm of an inn type restaurant with tables and chairs scattered about to take advantage of the meager seating.  We went on a Thursday and happened upon a table which I imagine is hard to find during busy times.  They advertise themselves as a wine bar and have a modest list of wines with a daily flight choice (very nice set of wines) for a reasonable cost.  Five glasses of 2 oz wines for $25.  We paired our wines with a cheese platter and personal pizza which turned out to be perfect for our occasion.  The service was sporadically attentive and casual.  There were many tables of people having a good time and singing with the live guitarist/musician who by the way was extremely talented and touched upon a set of very popular ballads enjoyed by I believe everyone at the restaurant.  The restaurant is decorated very sparsely but eclectic with some interesting details in the silverware and plates.  The noise level was very high making it somewhat difficult to carry on an intimate conversation.  If you are looking for something off the beaten path and away from the usual night out, I think that this may fit your bill.  I do like the energy of the people and place.

data.title: Great little gem
data.text:
We happened in here after dinner a few weeks ago. It's super adorable and quaint and feels like home. They're very laid-back, seat yourself, etc. We had a nice little table in the corner. The waitstaff and proprietors are sweet and knowledgeable -- very personable. They make you feel right at home! First, a few caveats:

1. The wine markup is HUGE. We checked the bottle we bought at a local retailer and what we paid versus what it sells for was ridiculous. I'm totally down for them to make money and keep their business afloat and I totally understand I'm paying for atmosphere and service as well as the wine but this was nuts.

2. The wine selection isn't big.

That said, it was such a great spot that I'll be supporting this place anyway and bringing friends. They had a menu which looked really creative and cute and some very fun desserts. The place has the kind of personality that you'd take an out-of-town guest there to really show off a hidden gem in your town and just know they'd love the little Austin-y touches. Would also be a really fun spot to do a birthday or other special event kick-off. We just won't stay for more than one bottle of pricey vino!

data.title: Love this place - great for date night
data.text:
This is a breath of fresh air to ad to downtown Frisco. Reminiscent of Austin where the owners hails from, this place is quaint but with enough style to be on the "nice evening out" check list. 

I really love the couple that owns the place. They are personable and fun to talk to. Go out and support this unique place for date night.
